segment.source: NVDA Dev & Test Toolbox
segment.target: NVDA Dev & Test Toolbox

segment.source: Author: Cyrille Bougot
segment.target: Author: Cyrille Bougot

segment.source: NVDA compatibility: 2019.2 and beyond
segment.target: NVDA compatibility: 2019.2 and beyond

segment.source: Download [stable version][1]
segment.target: Download [stable version][1]

segment.source: This add-on gathers various features for NVDA debugging and testing.
segment.target: This add-on gathers various features for NVDA debugging and testing.

segment.source: Features
segment.target: Features

segment.source: An enhanced restart dialog to specify some extra options when restarting NVDA.
segment.target: An enhanced restart dialog to specify some extra options when restarting NVDA.

segment.source: Various features related to logged errors.
segment.target: Various features related to logged errors.

segment.source: An object property explorer.
segment.target: An object property explorer.

segment.source: Script tools: an extended script description mode and a script opener.
segment.target: Script tools: an extended script description mode and a script opener.

segment.source: Commands to help log reading and analyzing.
segment.target: Commands to help log reading and analyzing.

segment.source: Backups of old logs
segment.target: Backups of old logs

segment.source: In the Python console workspace, a function to open the source code of an object.
segment.target: In the Python console workspace, a function to open the source code of an object.

segment.source: A custom startup script for the Python console
segment.target: A custom startup script for the Python console

segment.source: A command to log the stack trace of the speech.speak function.
segment.target: A command to log the stack trace of the speech.speak function.

segment.source: A command to reverse translate the items of the interface.
segment.target: A command to reverse translate the items of the interface.

segment.source: Commands
segment.target: Commands

segment.source: This add-on uses layered commands for all of the new commands it adds.
segment.target: This add-on uses layered commands for all of the new commands it adds.

segment.source: The entry point for these commands is `NVDA+X`; thus all the commands should be executed by `NVDA+X` followed by another single letter or gesture.
segment.target: The entry point for these commands is `NVDA+X`; thus all the commands should be executed by `NVDA+X` followed by another single letter or gesture.

segment.source: You can list all the available layered commands pressing `NVDA+X, H`.
segment.target: You can list all the available layered commands pressing `NVDA+X, H`.

segment.source: For the commands that you use more frequently, you can also define a direct gesture in the input gesture dialog.
segment.target: For the commands that you use more frequently, you can also define a direct gesture in the input gesture dialog.

segment.source: Enhanced restart dialog
segment.target: Enhanced restart dialog

segment.source: The `NVDA+X, Q` command opens a dialog to specify some extra options before restarting NVDA.
segment.target: The `NVDA+X, Q` command opens a dialog to specify some extra options before restarting NVDA.

segment.source: The options that can be specified correspond to the [command line options][2] that can be used with `nvda.exe`, e.g. `-c` for config path, `--disable-addons` to disable add-ons, etc.
segment.target: The options that can be specified correspond to the [command line options][2] that can be used with `nvda.exe`, e.g. `-c` for config path, `--disable-addons` to disable add-ons, etc.

segment.source: Features related to logged errors
segment.target: Features related to logged errors

segment.source: Report last logged error
segment.target: Report last logged error

segment.source: Pressing `NVDA+X, E` allows to report the last error logged without needing to open the log. A second press clears the memorized last error.
segment.target: Pressing `NVDA+X, E` allows to report the last error logged without needing to open the log. A second press clears the memorized last error.

segment.source: Play a sound for logged errors
segment.target: Play a sound for logged errors

segment.source: The ["Play a sound for logged errors" setting][4] has been introduced in NVDA 2021.3 and allows to specify if NVDA will play an error sound in case an error is logged.
segment.target: The ["Play a sound for logged errors" setting][4] has been introduced in NVDA 2021.3 and allows to specify if NVDA will play an error sound in case an error is logged.

segment.source: This add-on provides an additional command (`NVDA+X, shift+E`) to toggle this setting.
segment.target: This add-on provides an additional command (`NVDA+X, shift+E`) to toggle this setting.

segment.source: You can choose:
segment.target: You can choose:

segment.source: "Only in test versions" (default) to make NVDA play error sounds only if the current NVDA version is a test version (alpha, beta or run from source).
segment.target: "Only in test versions" (default) to make NVDA play error sounds only if the current NVDA version is a test version (alpha, beta or run from source).

segment.source: "Yes" to enable error sounds no matter your current NVDA version.
segment.target: "Yes" to enable error sounds no matter your current NVDA version.

segment.source: For NVDA prior to 2021.3, this add-on provides the backport of this feature and the possibility to control it with the keyboard command.
segment.target: For NVDA prior to 2021.3, this add-on provides the backport of this feature and the possibility to control it with the keyboard command.

segment.source: The checkbox in the Advanced settings panel is not backported however.
segment.target: The checkbox in the Advanced settings panel is not backported however.

segment.source: Object property explorer
segment.target: Object property explorer

segment.source: This feature allows to report some properties of the current navigator object without opening the log viewer.
segment.target: This feature allows to report some properties of the current navigator object without opening the log viewer.

segment.source: To list the properties of an object, move the navigator object to it and use the following commands:
segment.target: To list the properties of an object, move the navigator object to it and use the following commands:

segment.source: `NVDA+X, upArrow`: Selects the previous property and reports it for the navigator object.
segment.target: `NVDA+X, upArrow`: Selects the previous property and reports it for the navigator object.

segment.source: `NVDA+X, downArrow`: Selects the next property and reports it for the navigator object.
segment.target: `NVDA+X, downArrow`: Selects the next property and reports it for the navigator object.

segment.source: `NVDA+X, N`: Reports the currently selected property for the navigator object
segment.target: `NVDA+X, N`: Reports the currently selected property for the navigator object

segment.source: `NVDA+X, shift+N`: Displays the currently selected property for the navigator object in a browseable message
segment.target: `NVDA+X, shift+N`: Displays the currently selected property for the navigator object in a browseable message

segment.source: The list of the supported properties is the following:
segment.target: The list of the supported properties is the following:

segment.source: name, role, state, value, windowClassName, windowControlID, windowHandle, location, Python class, Python class mro.
segment.target: name, role, state, value, windowClassName, windowControlID, windowHandle, location, Python class, Python class mro.

segment.source: When using object navigation commands, you can also choose to have the currently selected property reported instead of NVDA usual object reporting.
segment.target: When using object navigation commands, you can also choose to have the currently selected property reported instead of NVDA usual object reporting.

segment.source: A toggle command, `NVDA+X, control+N`, allows to switch between this custom reporting of objects and NVDA usual reporting.
segment.target: A toggle command, `NVDA+X, control+N`, allows to switch between this custom reporting of objects and NVDA usual reporting.

segment.source: For exemple, you may select "windowClassName" property and enable custom object reporting.
segment.target: For exemple, you may select "windowClassName" property and enable custom object reporting.

segment.source: Then when moving the navigator object to next or previous object, you will hear the object's windowClassName instead of usual reporting.
segment.target: Then when moving the navigator object to next or previous object, you will hear the object's windowClassName instead of usual reporting.

segment.source: Script tools
segment.target: Script tools

segment.source: The script opener
segment.target: The script opener

segment.source: The script opener command allows to open the code of a script knowing its gesture.
segment.target: The script opener command allows to open the code of a script knowing its gesture.

segment.source: To use it press `NVDA+x, C` and then the gesture of the script which you want to see the code of.
segment.target: To use it press `NVDA+x, C` and then the gesture of the script which you want to see the code of.

segment.source: For example to see the code of the script that reports the title of the foreground window, press `NVDA+X, C` and then `NVDA+T`.
segment.target: For example to see the code of the script that reports the title of the foreground window, press `NVDA+X, C` and then `NVDA+T`.

segment.source: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.
segment.target: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.

segment.source: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.
segment.target: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.

segment.source: Extended script description mode
segment.target: Extended script description mode

segment.source: The extended script description mode allows to have reported information on scripts without description in input help mode.
segment.target: The extended script description mode allows to have reported information on scripts without description in input help mode.

segment.source: When the Extended script description mode is active, the input help mode (NVDA+1) is modified as follows.
segment.target: When the Extended script description mode is active, the input help mode (NVDA+1) is modified as follows.

segment.source: If a script has no description, the script's name and class are reported.
segment.target: If a script has no description, the script's name and class are reported.

segment.source: If a script has a description, its description is reported as usual.
segment.target: If a script has a description, its description is reported as usual.

segment.source: The gesture to activate or deactivate this feature is `NVDA+X, D`.
segment.target: The gesture to activate or deactivate this feature is `NVDA+X, D`.

segment.source: Executing a gesture bound to a script without description in input help mode also create an entry for this script in the gesture management dialog.
segment.target: Executing a gesture bound to a script without description in input help mode also create an entry for this script in the gesture management dialog.

segment.source: This entry is located in a dedicated category called "Scripts without description (modify at your own risk!)".
segment.target: This entry is located in a dedicated category called "Scripts without description (modify at your own risk!)".

segment.source: This allow to easily add, delete or change the native NVDA gestures for these script.
segment.target: This allow to easily add, delete or change the native NVDA gestures for these script.

segment.source: Be aware however that it is often intended that such script do not have any description to prevent the user to modify the associated gesture.
segment.target: Be aware however that it is often intended that such script do not have any description to prevent the user to modify the associated gesture.

segment.source: Indeed, the gesture may be defined to match an application shortcut key.
segment.target: Indeed, the gesture may be defined to match an application shortcut key.

segment.source: For example the script script_toggleItalic on NVDAObjects.window.winword.WordDocument is bound to control+I and this should not be modified since the gesture is passed to the application to actually execute the shortcut key.
segment.target: For example the script script_toggleItalic on NVDAObjects.window.winword.WordDocument is bound to control+I and this should not be modified since the gesture is passed to the application to actually execute the shortcut key.

segment.source: Usage example
segment.target: Usage example

segment.source: Control+shift+I also toggle italic in Word, even if it is not natively reported by NVDA.
segment.target: Control+shift+I also toggle italic in Word, even if it is not natively reported by NVDA.

segment.source: To have the control+shift+I result reported by NVDA as control+I, you should perform the following steps:
segment.target: To have the control+shift+I result reported by NVDA as control+I, you should perform the following steps:

segment.source: Open a Word document.
segment.target: Open a Word document.

segment.source: Enable the extended script description mode with `NVDA+X, D`.
segment.target: Enable the extended script description mode with `NVDA+X, D`.

segment.source: Enter input help mode with NVDA+1.
segment.target: Enter input help mode with NVDA+1.

segment.source: Press control+I to report the italic script and have it added in the gesture dialog.
segment.target: Press control+I to report the italic script and have it added in the gesture dialog.

segment.source: Exit input help mode with NVDA+1.
segment.target: Exit input help mode with NVDA+1.

segment.source: Open the input gestures dialog.
segment.target: Open the input gestures dialog.

segment.source: In the category "Scripts without description (modify at your own risk!)", select the command "toggleItalic on NVDAObjects.window.winword.WordDocument".
segment.target: In the category "Scripts without description (modify at your own risk!)", select the command "toggleItalic on NVDAObjects.window.winword.WordDocument".

segment.source: Add the control+shift+I shortcut and validate.
segment.target: Add the control+shift+I shortcut and validate.

segment.source: If you want, exit the extended script description mode with `NVDA+X, D`.
segment.target: If you want, exit the extended script description mode with `NVDA+X, D`.

segment.source: Known bug: A script added for a specific class is visible even if gesture manager is opened in another context.
segment.target: Known bug: A script added for a specific class is visible even if gesture manager is opened in another context.

segment.source: Log reading and analyzing features
segment.target: Log reading and analyzing features

segment.source: Place markers in the log
segment.target: Place markers in the log

segment.source: While testing or working, you may want to mark a specific moment in the log, so that you can turn to it easily later when reading the log.
segment.target: While testing or working, you may want to mark a specific moment in the log, so that you can turn to it easily later when reading the log.

segment.source: To add a marker message in the log, press `NVDA+X, K`.
segment.target: To add a marker message in the log, press `NVDA+X, K`.

segment.source: A message as follows will be logged at INFO level:
segment.target: A message as follows will be logged at INFO level:

segment.source: `-- NDTT marker 0 --`
segment.target: `-- NDTT marker 0 --`

segment.source: You can add as many markers as you want in the log.
segment.target: You can add as many markers as you want in the log.

segment.source: The marker's number will be incremented each time you place a marker in the log; it will only be reset when NVDA is restarted.
segment.target: The marker's number will be incremented each time you place a marker in the log; it will only be reset when NVDA is restarted.

segment.source: Log reader mode
segment.target: Log reader mode

segment.source: A log reader mode provides commands to ease log reading and analyzing.
segment.target: A log reader mode provides commands to ease log reading and analyzing.

segment.source: In the log viewer window the log reader is enabled by default, thus log reading commands are available immediately.
segment.target: In the log viewer window the log reader is enabled by default, thus log reading commands are available immediately.

segment.source: In another text reading area such as an editor (e.g. Notepad++) or a webpage (e.g. GitHub issue), you need to press `NVDA+X, L` to enable log reader mode and use its commands.
segment.target: In another text reading area such as an editor (e.g. Notepad++) or a webpage (e.g. GitHub issue), you need to press `NVDA+X, L` to enable log reader mode and use its commands.

segment.source: When you are done with log reading and analyzing tasks, you can disable again `NVDA+X, L` to disable the log reader mode.
segment.target: When you are done with log reading and analyzing tasks, you can disable again `NVDA+X, L` to disable the log reader mode.

segment.source: The commands available in log reader mode are described hereafter.
segment.target: The commands available in log reader mode are described hereafter.

segment.source: Quick navigation commands
segment.target: Quick navigation commands

segment.source: Single letter command similar to browse mode quick navigation keys allow to move to various type of log messages:
segment.target: Single letter command similar to browse mode quick navigation keys allow to move to various type of log messages:

segment.source: m: any message
segment.target: m: any message

segment.source: e: error messages (`ERROR` and `CRITICAL`)
segment.target: e: error messages (`ERROR` and `CRITICAL`)

segment.source: w: warning messages (`WARNING`)
segment.target: w: warning messages (`WARNING`)

segment.source: f: info messages (`INFO`)
segment.target: f: info messages (`INFO`)

segment.source: k: markers previously [placed in the log](#logPlaceMarkers)
segment.target: k: markers previously [placed in the log](#logPlaceMarkers)

segment.source: g: debug warning messages (`DEBUGWARNING`)
segment.target: g: debug warning messages (`DEBUGWARNING`)

segment.source: i: input/output messages (`IO`)
segment.target: i: input/output messages (`IO`)

segment.source: n: input messages
segment.target: n: input messages

segment.source: s: speech messages
segment.target: s: speech messages

segment.source: d: debug messages (`DEBUG`)
segment.target: d: debug messages (`DEBUG`)

segment.source: Pressing the single letter moves to the next occurrence of this message. Combining the letter with the shift key moves to the previous occurrence of this message.
segment.target: Pressing the single letter moves to the next occurrence of this message. Combining the letter with the shift key moves to the previous occurrence of this message.

segment.source: Translation of speech message
segment.target: Translation of speech message

segment.source: Sometimes, you may have to look at a log taken on a system in a foreignh language that you do not understand. E.g. the log was taken on a Chinese system / NVDA, whereas you only understand French.
segment.target: Sometimes, you may have to look at a log taken on a system in a foreignh language that you do not understand. E.g. the log was taken on a Chinese system / NVDA, whereas you only understand French.

segment.source: If you have [Instant Translate][3] add-on installed, you may use it in conjonction with [quick log navigation commands](#logReaderQuickNavigationCommands) to have speech messages translated.
segment.target: If you have [Instant Translate][3] add-on installed, you may use it in conjonction with [quick log navigation commands](#logReaderQuickNavigationCommands) to have speech messages translated.

segment.source: First configure Instant Translate's languages. The source language should be the language of the system where the log has been taken (e.g. Chinese). The target language should be your language (e.g. French).
segment.target: First configure Instant Translate's languages. The source language should be the language of the system where the log has been taken (e.g. Chinese). The target language should be your language (e.g. French).

segment.source: Open the log
segment.target: Open the log

segment.source: Press T to enable automatic speech translation in the log
segment.target: Press T to enable automatic speech translation in the log

segment.source: Use Quick navigation commands in the log, e.g. S, I, etc. Whenever a speech message is encountered, it will be spoken in your language (French in our previous example)
segment.target: Use Quick navigation commands in the log, e.g. S, I, etc. Whenever a speech message is encountered, it will be spoken in your language (French in our previous example)

segment.source: If you want to disable speech translation, press T again.
segment.target: If you want to disable speech translation, press T again.

segment.source: Open the file of the source code in your editor
segment.target: Open the file of the source code in your editor

segment.source: In the log some line may refer to the source code:
segment.target: In the log some line may refer to the source code:

segment.source: A line belonging to a traceback contains the path and the line in a file, e.g.:
segment.target: A line belonging to a traceback contains the path and the line in a file, e.g.:

segment.source: ` File "virtualBuffers\__init__.pyc", line 226, in _getStoryLength`
segment.target: ` File "virtualBuffers\__init__.pyc", line 226, in _getStoryLength`

segment.source: The header line of a logged message contains the function which has logged this message, e.g.:
segment.target: The header line of a logged message contains the function which has logged this message, e.g.:

segment.source: `INFO - config.ConfigManager._loadConfig (22:45:26.145) - MainThread (16580):`
segment.target: `INFO - config.ConfigManager._loadConfig (22:45:26.145) - MainThread (16580):`

segment.source: The content of a message logged in input help mode (logged at info level):
segment.target: The content of a message logged in input help mode (logged at info level):

segment.source: `Input help: gesture kb(desktop):NVDA+t, bound to script title on globalCommands.GlobalCommands`
segment.target: `Input help: gesture kb(desktop):NVDA+t, bound to script title on globalCommands.GlobalCommands`

segment.source: You may want to open the file containing this code to understand the context of the traceback or the logged message.
segment.target: You may want to open the file containing this code to understand the context of the traceback or the logged message.

segment.source: Just press C to open this file.
segment.target: Just press C to open this file.

segment.source: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.
segment.target: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.

segment.source: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.
segment.target: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.

segment.source: Backup of old logs
segment.target: Backup of old logs

segment.source: NVDA already provides a backup of the log of the previous session of NVDA; the file is called `nvda-old.log`.
segment.target: NVDA already provides a backup of the log of the previous session of NVDA; the file is called `nvda-old.log`.

segment.source: Sometimes however you may want to access older logs, e.g. because you have had to restart NVDA again before looking at `nvda-old.log`.
segment.target: Sometimes however you may want to access older logs, e.g. because you have had to restart NVDA again before looking at `nvda-old.log`.

segment.source: This add-on allows you to configure if you want to backup old logs and how many of them; this is done in the [add-on's settings](#settingsLogsBackup).
segment.target: This add-on allows you to configure if you want to backup old logs and how many of them; this is done in the [add-on's settings](#settingsLogsBackup).

segment.source: A log manager dialog allows to view the backed up logs.
segment.target: A log manager dialog allows to view the backed up logs.

segment.source: It can be opened going to NVDA menu -> Tools -> Logs manager
segment.target: It can be opened going to NVDA menu -> Tools -> Logs manager

segment.source: In this dialog, you can see the list of all the backup logs and perform various actions on the selected log:
segment.target: In this dialog, you can see the list of all the backup logs and perform various actions on the selected log:

segment.source: open it (press `Enter`)
segment.target: open it (press `Enter`)

segment.source: delete it (press `Delete`)
segment.target: delete it (press `Delete`)

segment.source: copy the log file (press `control+C`)
segment.target: copy the log file (press `control+C`)

segment.source: You can also select multiple logs to perform an actions on all of them.
segment.target: You can also select multiple logs to perform an actions on all of them.

segment.source: To be able to open a log, you should first have configured the [Command to open a file in your favorite editor](#settingsOpenCommand).
segment.target: To be able to open a log, you should first have configured the [Command to open a file in your favorite editor](#settingsOpenCommand).

segment.source: Python console extension
segment.target: Python console extension

segment.source: `openCodeFile` function
segment.target: `openCodeFile` function

segment.source: In the console, you can call the following function to view the source code that defines the variable `myVar`:
segment.target: In the console, you can call the following function to view the source code that defines the variable `myVar`:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(myVar)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(myVar)`

segment.source: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.
segment.target: For this feature to work, you need to have configured your [favorite editor's command](#settingsOpenCommand) in the add-on's settings.

segment.source: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.
segment.target: If you are not running NVDA from source, the [location of NVDA source code](#settingsNvdaSourcePath) should also have been configured.

segment.source: The `openCodeFile` functions can be called on objects defined in NVDA's code or on objects defined by add-ons.
segment.target: The `openCodeFile` functions can be called on objects defined in NVDA's code or on objects defined by add-ons.

segment.source: It cannot be called on objects whose source code is not available such as python builtins.
segment.target: It cannot be called on objects whose source code is not available such as python builtins.

segment.source: If you have not yet imported the object in the console, you can also pass its name as parameter to the `openCodeFile` function.
segment.target: If you have not yet imported the object in the console, you can also pass its name as parameter to the `openCodeFile` function.

segment.source: Below are examples of call in NVDA's code:
segment.target: Below are examples of call in NVDA's code:

segment.source: View the definition of the function `speech.speech.speak`:
segment.target: View the definition of the function `speech.speech.speak`:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(speech.speech.speak)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(speech.speech.speak)`

segment.source: or with the name passed as parameter:
segment.target: or with the name passed as parameter:

segment.source: `openCodeFile("speech.speech.speak")`
segment.target: `openCodeFile("speech.speech.speak")`

segment.source: View the definition of the class `TextInfo`:
segment.target: View the definition of the class `TextInfo`:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(textInfos.TextInfo)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(textInfos.TextInfo)`

segment.source: View the definition of the method `copyToClipboard` of the class `TextInfo`:
segment.target: View the definition of the method `copyToClipboard` of the class `TextInfo`:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(textInfos.TextInfo.copyToClipboard)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(textInfos.TextInfo.copyToClipboard)`

segment.source: View the definition of the class of the focused object:
segment.target: View the definition of the class of the focused object:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(focus)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(focus)`

segment.source: Open the file `api.py` defining the module `api`:
segment.target: Open the file `api.py` defining the module `api`:

segment.source: `openCodeFile(api)`
segment.target: `openCodeFile(api)`

segment.source: Python console startup script
segment.target: Python console startup script

segment.source: You can define a custom script which will be executed in the Python console's namespace when it is first opened, or if the add-on is reloaded (NVDA+F3) after the console has already been opened.
segment.target: You can define a custom script which will be executed in the Python console's namespace when it is first opened, or if the add-on is reloaded (NVDA+F3) after the console has already been opened.

segment.source: For example, the script allows you to execute new imports and define aliases that you will be able to use directly in the console, as shown below:
segment.target: For example, the script allows you to execute new imports and define aliases that you will be able to use directly in the console, as shown below:

segment.source: # Various import that I want in the console.
segment.target: # Various import that I want in the console.

segment.source: import globalVars as gv
segment.target: import globalVars as gv

segment.source: import core
segment.target: import core

segment.source: import ui
segment.target: import ui

segment.source: # Aliases
segment.target: # Aliases

segment.source: ocf = openCodeFile
segment.target: ocf = openCodeFile

segment.source: The Python console script should be placed in the following location: `pathToNVDAConfig\ndtt\consoleStartup.py`
segment.target: The Python console script should be placed in the following location: `pathToNVDAConfig\ndtt\consoleStartup.py`

segment.source: For example: `C:\Users\myUserName\AppData\Roaming\nvda\ndtt\consoleStartup.py`
segment.target: For example: `C:\Users\myUserName\AppData\Roaming\nvda\ndtt\consoleStartup.py`

segment.source: Log the stack trace of the speech function
segment.target: Log the stack trace of the speech function

segment.source: Sometimes, you may want to see which part of the code is responsible for speaking something.
segment.target: Sometimes, you may want to see which part of the code is responsible for speaking something.

segment.source: For this, you can enable the stack trace logging of the speech function pressing `NVDA+X, S`.
segment.target: For this, you can enable the stack trace logging of the speech function pressing `NVDA+X, S`.

segment.source: Each time NVDA speaks, a corresponding stack trace will be logged in the log.
segment.target: Each time NVDA speaks, a corresponding stack trace will be logged in the log.

segment.source: Note: You may modify the script's file directly to patch another function.
segment.target: Note: You may modify the script's file directly to patch another function.

segment.source: See all instructions in the file for details on usage.
segment.target: See all instructions in the file for details on usage.

segment.source: Reverse translation command
segment.target: Reverse translation command

segment.source: Many testers use NVDA in another language than English.
segment.target: Many testers use NVDA in another language than English.

segment.source: But when reporting test results on GitHub, the description of the modified options or the messages reported by NVDA should be written in English.
segment.target: But when reporting test results on GitHub, the description of the modified options or the messages reported by NVDA should be written in English.

segment.source: Its quite frustrating and time consuming to have to restart NVDA in English to check the exact wording of the options or messages.
segment.target: Its quite frustrating and time consuming to have to restart NVDA in English to check the exact wording of the options or messages.

segment.source: To avoid this, the add-on provides a reverse translation command (`NVDA+X, R`) allowing to reverse translate NVDA's interface such as messages, control labels in the GUI, etc.
segment.target: To avoid this, the add-on provides a reverse translation command (`NVDA+X, R`) allowing to reverse translate NVDA's interface such as messages, control labels in the GUI, etc.

segment.source: This command uses NVDA's gettext translation to try to reverse translate the last speech.
segment.target: This command uses NVDA's gettext translation to try to reverse translate the last speech.

segment.source: More specifically, the first string of the last speech sequence is reverse translated.
segment.target: More specifically, the first string of the last speech sequence is reverse translated.

segment.source: For example, in French NVDA, if I arrow down to the Tools menu named "Outils", NVDA will say "Outils sous-Menu o" which stands for "Tools subMenu o".
segment.target: For example, in French NVDA, if I arrow down to the Tools menu named "Outils", NVDA will say "Outils sous-Menu o" which stands for "Tools subMenu o".

segment.source: If I press the reverse translation command just after that, NVDA will reverse translate "Outils" to "Tools".
segment.target: If I press the reverse translation command just after that, NVDA will reverse translate "Outils" to "Tools".

segment.source: Looking at the log afterwards, we can find the following lines:
segment.target: Looking at the log afterwards, we can find the following lines:

segment.source: IO - speech.speech.speak (23:38:24.450) - MainThread (2044):
segment.target: IO - speech.speech.speak (23:38:24.450) - MainThread (2044):

segment.source: Speaking ['Outils', 'sous-Menu', CharacterModeCommand(True), 'o', CharacterModeCommand(False), CancellableSpeech (still valid)]
segment.target: Speaking ['Outils', 'sous-Menu', CharacterModeCommand(True), 'o', CharacterModeCommand(False), CancellableSpeech (still valid)]

segment.source: This confirms that "Outils was the first string in the speech sequence.
segment.target: This confirms that "Outils was the first string in the speech sequence.

segment.source: In case the reverse translation leads to two or more possible results, a context menu is opened listing all the possibilities.
segment.target: In case the reverse translation leads to two or more possible results, a context menu is opened listing all the possibilities.

segment.source: The result of the reverse translation is also copied to the clipboard if the corresponding [option](#settingsCopyReverseTranslation) is enabled, which is the default value.
segment.target: The result of the reverse translation is also copied to the clipboard if the corresponding [option](#settingsCopyReverseTranslation) is enabled, which is the default value.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Some features of the add-on may require a specific configuration.
segment.target: Some features of the add-on may require a specific configuration.

segment.source: A settings panel allows to enable them or to control how they work.
segment.target: A settings panel allows to enable them or to control how they work.

segment.source: To view and modify these settings, go to NVDA menu -> Preferences and select the category NVDA Dev & Test Toolbox.
segment.target: To view and modify these settings, go to NVDA menu -> Preferences and select the category NVDA Dev & Test Toolbox.

segment.source: This settings dialog can also be accessed directly from the Logs Manager dialog.
segment.target: This settings dialog can also be accessed directly from the Logs Manager dialog.

segment.source: These settings are global and can only be configured when the default profile is active.
segment.target: These settings are global and can only be configured when the default profile is active.

segment.source: Command to open a file in your favorite editor
segment.target: Command to open a file in your favorite editor

segment.source: Some features allow to see content in your favorite editor.
segment.target: Some features allow to see content in your favorite editor.

segment.source: This includes the commands to view the source file [from a log](#logReaderOpenSourceFile), [from an object in the console](#pythonConsoleOpenCodeFile) or [from a typed gesture](#scriptOpener), as well as the [log manager](#oldLogsBackup)'s Open button.
segment.target: This includes the commands to view the source file [from a log](#logReaderOpenSourceFile), [from an object in the console](#pythonConsoleOpenCodeFile) or [from a typed gesture](#scriptOpener), as well as the [log manager](#oldLogsBackup)'s Open button.

segment.source: To use them, you first need to configure the command that will be called to open the file in your favorite editor.
segment.target: To use them, you first need to configure the command that will be called to open the file in your favorite editor.

segment.source: The command should be of the form:
segment.target: The command should be of the form:

segment.source: `"C:\path\to\my\editor\editor.exe" "{path}":{line}`
segment.target: `"C:\path\to\my\editor\editor.exe" "{path}":{line}`

segment.source: You should of course modify this line according to the real name and location of your editor and the syntax used by it to open files.
segment.target: You should of course modify this line according to the real name and location of your editor and the syntax used by it to open files.

segment.source: `{path}` will be replaced by the full path of the file to open and `{line}` by the line number where you want the cursor to be set.
segment.target: `{path}` will be replaced by the full path of the file to open and `{line}` by the line number where you want the cursor to be set.

segment.source: For Notepad++ for example the command to type in the console would be:
segment.target: For Notepad++ for example the command to type in the console would be:

segment.source: `"C:\Program Files\Notepad++\notepad++.exe" "{path}" -n{line}`
segment.target: `"C:\Program Files\Notepad++\notepad++.exe" "{path}" -n{line}`

segment.source: NVDA source code path
segment.target: NVDA source code path

segment.source: When using a command to view the source file [from a log](#logReaderOpenSourceFile), [from an object in the console](#pythonConsoleOpenCodeFile) or [from a typed gesture](#scriptOpener), the file may belong to NVDA itself.
segment.target: When using a command to view the source file [from a log](#logReaderOpenSourceFile), [from an object in the console](#pythonConsoleOpenCodeFile) or [from a typed gesture](#scriptOpener), the file may belong to NVDA itself.

segment.source: If you are not running NVDA from source, your NVDA only contains compiled files.
segment.target: If you are not running NVDA from source, your NVDA only contains compiled files.

segment.source: Thus you may specify here an alternate location where the corresponding source file will be found, e.g. the place where you have cloned NVDA source files, so that a source file can be opened anyway.
segment.target: Thus you may specify here an alternate location where the corresponding source file will be found, e.g. the place where you have cloned NVDA source files, so that a source file can be opened anyway.

segment.source: The path should be such as:
segment.target: The path should be such as:

segment.source: `C:\pathExample\GIT\nvda\source`
segment.target: `C:\pathExample\GIT\nvda\source`

segment.source: Of course, replace the path of NVDA source with the correct one.
segment.target: Of course, replace the path of NVDA source with the correct one.

segment.source: Be sure however that the version of your source file (e.g. GIT commit) is the same as the one of the running instance of NVDA.
segment.target: Be sure however that the version of your source file (e.g. GIT commit) is the same as the one of the running instance of NVDA.

segment.source: Backup of old logs
segment.target: Backup of old logs

segment.source: The combobox Backup of old logs allows to enable or disable the [feature](#oldLogsBackup).
segment.target: The combobox Backup of old logs allows to enable or disable the [feature](#oldLogsBackup).

segment.source: If it is enabled, you can also specify below in "Limit the number of backups" the maximum number of backups you want to keep.
segment.target: If it is enabled, you can also specify below in "Limit the number of backups" the maximum number of backups you want to keep.

segment.source: These settings only take effect at next NVDA startup when the backup takes place.
segment.target: These settings only take effect at next NVDA startup when the backup takes place.

segment.source: Copy reverse translation to clipboard
segment.target: Copy reverse translation to clipboard

segment.source: This option allows to choose if the [reverse translation command](#reverseTranslationCommand) also copies its result to the clipboard.
segment.target: This option allows to choose if the [reverse translation command](#reverseTranslationCommand) also copies its result to the clipboard.

segment.source: Change log
segment.target: Change log

segment.source: Version 7.1
segment.target: Version 7.1

segment.source: Compatibility with NVDA 2025.1.
segment.target: Compatibility with NVDA 2025.1.

segment.source: Version 7.0
segment.target: Version 7.0

segment.source: Layered commands have been introduced; the entry point is `NVDA+X`.
segment.target: Layered commands have been introduced; the entry point is `NVDA+X`.

segment.source: The existing commands have been modified accordingly.
segment.target: The existing commands have been modified accordingly.

segment.source: A new command (`NVDA+X, R`) to reverse translate the last spoken message.
segment.target: A new command (`NVDA+X, R`) to reverse translate the last spoken message.

segment.source: A new command (`NVDA+X, C`) to open the source code of the script associated to the next pressed gesture.
segment.target: A new command (`NVDA+X, C`) to open the source code of the script associated to the next pressed gesture.

segment.source: Added speech on demand support.
segment.target: Added speech on demand support.

segment.source: The log manager now allows more actions, either with the dedicated buttons in the dialogs or using keyboard shortcuts in the list: `enter` to open the log, `control+C` to copy the log file and `delete` to delete a log file.
segment.target: The log manager now allows more actions, either with the dedicated buttons in the dialogs or using keyboard shortcuts in the list: `enter` to open the log, `control+C` to copy the log file and `delete` to delete a log file.

segment.source: The sorting order in the log manager has been reversed (most recent log on top).
segment.target: The sorting order in the log manager has been reversed (most recent log on top).

segment.source: Fixed an issue when trying to open a Python module with openCodeFile function.
segment.target: Fixed an issue when trying to open a Python module with openCodeFile function.

segment.source: Version 6.3
segment.target: Version 6.3

segment.source: Compatibility with NVDA 2024.1.
segment.target: Compatibility with NVDA 2024.1.

segment.source: Version 6.2
segment.target: Version 6.2

segment.source: Restores console opening for NVDA < 2021.1.
segment.target: Restores console opening for NVDA < 2021.1.

segment.source: Addresses potential security issues related to [GHSA-xg6w-23rw-39r8][5] when using the add-on with older versions of NVDA. However, it is recommended to use NVDA 2023.3.3 or higher.
segment.target: Addresses potential security issues related to [GHSA-xg6w-23rw-39r8][5] when using the add-on with older versions of NVDA. However, it is recommended to use NVDA 2023.3.3 or higher.

segment.source: Version 6.1
segment.target: Version 6.1

segment.source: Opening the source file of an object located in the submodule of a package is now working.
segment.target: Opening the source file of an object located in the submodule of a package is now working.

segment.source: Bugfix: The enhanced exit dialog can now be reopened and used as expected after having been closed. (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)
segment.target: Bugfix: The enhanced exit dialog can now be reopened and used as expected after having been closed. (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)

segment.source: Version 6.0
segment.target: Version 6.0

segment.source: While using object navigation commands, a specific object property can be reported instead of NVDA usual object reporting.
segment.target: While using object navigation commands, a specific object property can be reported instead of NVDA usual object reporting.

segment.source: In log reading mode, the "C" key to open a code file from the log now also works on an input help message.
segment.target: In log reading mode, the "C" key to open a code file from the log now also works on an input help message.

segment.source: Bugfix: The add-on can now start successfully when the number of logs to save is set to its maximum value.
segment.target: Bugfix: The add-on can now start successfully when the number of logs to save is set to its maximum value.

segment.source: Bugfix: Python console startup script's output does not prevent anymore to jump to the first result in the console when using result navigation commands.
segment.target: Bugfix: Python console startup script's output does not prevent anymore to jump to the first result in the console when using result navigation commands.

segment.source: Note: From now on, localization updates will not appear anymore in the change log.
segment.target: Note: From now on, localization updates will not appear anymore in the change log.

segment.source: Version 5.0
segment.target: Version 5.0

segment.source: If Instant Translate add-on is installed, it is now possible to have speech messages translated on the fly when using log reading commands.
segment.target: If Instant Translate add-on is installed, it is now possible to have speech messages translated on the fly when using log reading commands.

segment.source: While in log reading mode, pressing E or shift+E now jumps to CRITICAL erorr messages as well as normal ERROR messages.
segment.target: While in log reading mode, pressing E or shift+E now jumps to CRITICAL erorr messages as well as normal ERROR messages.

segment.source: New log quick navigation commands have been added to jump to input and to speech messages.
segment.target: New log quick navigation commands have been added to jump to input and to speech messages.

segment.source: A new command allow to place a marker in the log; and specific quick navigation commands in log reading mode allow to jump to them.
segment.target: A new command allow to place a marker in the log; and specific quick navigation commands in log reading mode allow to jump to them.

segment.source: Credit: the initial idea for this feature comes from Debug Helper add-on by Luke Davis.
segment.target: Credit: the initial idea for this feature comes from Debug Helper add-on by Luke Davis.

segment.source: Bubfix: The memorization of the last error do not fail anymore in some cases.
segment.target: Bubfix: The memorization of the last error do not fail anymore in some cases.

segment.source: Bugfix: The add-on can initialize again with NVDA 2019.2.1.
segment.target: Bugfix: The add-on can initialize again with NVDA 2019.2.1.

segment.source: Bugfix: Log saving feature will not fail anymore with non-ASCII logs.
segment.target: Bugfix: Log saving feature will not fail anymore with non-ASCII logs.

segment.source: Version 4.2
segment.target: Version 4.2

segment.source: Fixed an error with NVDA version below 2021.3.
segment.target: Fixed an error with NVDA version below 2021.3.

segment.source: Fixed the stack trace log formatting.
segment.target: Fixed the stack trace log formatting.

segment.source: First localizations.
segment.target: First localizations.

segment.source: Version 4.1
segment.target: Version 4.1

segment.source: Fixed a bug occurring in some situations while logging an error.
segment.target: Fixed a bug occurring in some situations while logging an error.

segment.source: The add-on's settings can now be modified only when the default profile is active to avoid config issues.
segment.target: The add-on's settings can now be modified only when the default profile is active to avoid config issues.

segment.source: Version 4.0
segment.target: Version 4.0

segment.source: Possibility to back up old logs and introduction of a logs manager.
segment.target: Possibility to back up old logs and introduction of a logs manager.

segment.source: Added a script to report the last logged error.
segment.target: Added a script to report the last logged error.

segment.source: Fixed a bug preventing last log message to be read in older NVDA versions.
segment.target: Fixed a bug preventing last log message to be read in older NVDA versions.

segment.source: Version 3.2
segment.target: Version 3.2

segment.source: Compatibility with NVDA 2023.1.
segment.target: Compatibility with NVDA 2023.1.

segment.source: Version 3.1
segment.target: Version 3.1

segment.source: Fixed an error occurring when requesting unavailable information on an object.
segment.target: Fixed an error occurring when requesting unavailable information on an object.

segment.source: Version 3.0
segment.target: Version 3.0

segment.source: In a log, you can now press C on a message's header line to open the function/module which has emitted it.
segment.target: In a log, you can now press C on a message's header line to open the function/module which has emitted it.

segment.source: In the console, `openCodeFile` function can now receive as parameter the object or a string containing its name.
segment.target: In the console, `openCodeFile` function can now receive as parameter the object or a string containing its name.

segment.source: New feature: NVDA console startup file: If it exists, the file YourNVDAConfigFolder\ndtt\consoleStartup.py will be executed when NVDA console is first opened or when add-ons are reloaded.
segment.target: New feature: NVDA console startup file: If it exists, the file YourNVDAConfigFolder\ndtt\consoleStartup.py will be executed when NVDA console is first opened or when add-ons are reloaded.

segment.source: Various minor fixes for `openCodeFile` Python console's function and the command to open the source file corresponding to a line in the log.
segment.target: Various minor fixes for `openCodeFile` Python console's function and the command to open the source file corresponding to a line in the log.

segment.source: Fixed an issue when trying to report roles/states for object explorer in older version of NVDA.
segment.target: Fixed an issue when trying to report roles/states for object explorer in older version of NVDA.

segment.source: The add-on does not cause a problem anymore with the tree interceptor when using UIA in Edge.
segment.target: The add-on does not cause a problem anymore with the tree interceptor when using UIA in Edge.

segment.source: Version 2.1
segment.target: Version 2.1

segment.source: Various bugfixes and code refactoring/cleaning to address all use cases: all supported versions, installed vs. run from source, etc. (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)
segment.target: Various bugfixes and code refactoring/cleaning to address all use cases: all supported versions, installed vs. run from source, etc. (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)

segment.source: Rewriting of the compa module (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)
segment.target: Rewriting of the compa module (contribution from Łukasz Golonka)

segment.source: The restart dialog can now be opened only once.
segment.target: The restart dialog can now be opened only once.

segment.source: The object explorer shortcuts are now unassigned by default and need to be mapped by the user.
segment.target: The object explorer shortcuts are now unassigned by default and need to be mapped by the user.

segment.source: With the object explorer, a double-press to call the script to report the current object's property now displays the reported information in a browseable message.
segment.target: With the object explorer, a double-press to call the script to report the current object's property now displays the reported information in a browseable message.

segment.source: Version 2.0
segment.target: Version 2.0

segment.source: New feature: Enhanced restart dialog to specify some extra options when restarting NVDA.
segment.target: New feature: Enhanced restart dialog to specify some extra options when restarting NVDA.

segment.source: New feature: extended description mode.
segment.target: New feature: extended description mode.

segment.source: Play error sound feature harmonized between pre and post 2021.3 versions of NVDA.
segment.target: Play error sound feature harmonized between pre and post 2021.3 versions of NVDA.

segment.source: New feature: Log reader commands are now available in the log viewer and also optionally in edit fields or webpages.
segment.target: New feature: Log reader commands are now available in the log viewer and also optionally in edit fields or webpages.

segment.source: New feature: In the Python console, an `openCodeFile` function is available to view the source code of an object.
segment.target: New feature: In the Python console, an `openCodeFile` function is available to view the source code of an object.

segment.source: Some features are now disabled in secure mode for security reasons.
segment.target: Some features are now disabled in secure mode for security reasons.

segment.source: The add-on's compatibility range has been extended (from 2019.2 to 2021.1).
segment.target: The add-on's compatibility range has been extended (from 2019.2 to 2021.1).

segment.source: Releases are now performed with GitHub action instead of appVeyor.
segment.target: Releases are now performed with GitHub action instead of appVeyor.

segment.source: Version 1.0
segment.target: Version 1.0

segment.source: Initial release.
segment.target: Initial release.
